alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Milwaukee; Racine (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 7:25AM CST until January 10 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow, mainly this afternoon into early this evening. Additional snow accumulation of 4 to 8 inches across western portions of Milwaukee, Racine and Kenosha counties. For eastern portions of these counties, snowfall will range from 1 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Milwaukee, Racine and Kenosha Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility this evening. This will impact the afternoon and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will be brief lulls in snow this morning with the moderate to heavy snow moving into the area from southwest to northeast by early afternoon. Rain will mix with snow from the lake front to approximately five miles inland.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
